div.ab: They want to be pruned often, otherwise they die & do not bear fruit so beautiful.

div.head: Cannons
div.ab: They are very difficult to bore when they are of metal since the material is brittle & frangible. But you must not push the borer too strongly or push all at once, but pull it out often. In that case, the muzzle of the cannon is bigger than the ball in order to avoid the necessity of drilling, because the material is cast & expands & pushes the mold. The drill should be neither like a swallow tail, nor a point, but should cut in the round like a wimble. If it breaks, one ought not leave it there to rust +

left-top + but immediately take it out of the touch-hole. Which you will do by pouring a little oil on it and then turn the place of the touch-hole downwards and & strike the opposite side from the touch-hole, & it will fall out. It is necessary and at ease drill gently & with ease when a piece is of metal.

div.head: Bells
div.ab: One does not make them in the pit if they do not fit.

div.head: Gilding your molding for panels without gold
div.ab: Some take orpiment in leaf form & pulverize it & make moresque leaves & burnish it, and it is this orpiment which is shiny like gold. However, ground metals or ground cristallin or touchstone are better.

div.head: Orpiment orange
div.ab: One sublimates it & one grinds it & some put in a little arsenic to make it melt instead.

Some make this of mastic with two ounces of mastic and one of clear & white turpentine oil & eau de vye as above. Heat it on ashes until it is melted, then let it rest & put it in another vessel to purge it of dregs.
